title: MT61129: Diffusion In Metallurgical Processes - Quick Facts
text:
MT61129
Course name | Diffusion In Metallurgical Processes
Offered by | Metallurgical & Materials Engineering
Credits | 4
L-T-P | 3-1-0
Previous Year Grade Distribution
{{{grades}}}
Semester | Autumn

title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Introduction: review of basic concepts, Fick's laws; measurement of diffusion coefficients; formation of defects, movement of defects, random walk; atomistics of diffusion, mechanism, effect of pressure, temperature and various driving forces on diffusion in ceramics and semiconducting materials, grain boundary and surface diffusion; applications; theories of creep and design of creep resistant alloys, prediction of creep life; diffusion theory of sintering, carburising, nitriding and metallising; diffusion welding, diffusion of gases and swelling of nuclear fuels.
